title: Experience
text:
Geneva, Switzerland Â· Februaryâ€“May 2025 - Forecasted demand and identified target pricing for essential maternal health medications, including Tranexamic Acid and Misoprostol.
- Developed a CatBoost-based machine learning pipeline to predict antibiotic prescription and delayed hospitalization using TIMCI pediatric health data.
- Addressed extreme class imbalance and facility-level clustering, and engineered complex clinical outcome features to improve model performance.







Bethlehem, PA Â· January 2024 â€“ June 2025 - Built predictive models in Python for non-invasive Alzheimerâ€™s detection, applying eXplainable AI (XAI) methods for model transparency and interpretability (DARWIN dataset).
- Analyzed large-scale datasets from NACC and ADNI to identify key biomarkers and improve diagnostic tools for Alzheimerâ€™s disease.



Bethlehem, PA Â· August 2023 â€“ May 2025 - Co-designed the Culture and Postpartum Experiences Interview Study with Fauzia Saiyed, PhD, from proposal development through IRB approval and manuscript drafting.
- Led participant recruitment, conducted interviews, performed transcription, and engaged in grounded theoryâ€“based analysis.



Bethlehem, PA Â· August â€“ December 2024 - Designed and analyzed a user satisfaction survey targeting Mobile and Pervasive Assistive Technologies (MPATs).
- Supported pilot testing of CityGuide, a beacon-based indoor navigation system for individuals with disabilities.



Bethlehem, PA Â· May â€“ August 2024 - Conducted a comprehensive literature review on assistive technologies supporting transition-age individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).
- Gained cross-disciplinary experience in disability research, public health, and human-centered technology development.



Bethlehem, PA Â· September 2022 â€“ May 2023 - Developed a community-level data repository tracking infections and chronic diseases using statewide SDOH indicators.
- Supported analyses to guide public health priorities and inform policy.



Bethlehem, PA & Sierra Leone Â· January â€“ December 2022 - Co-developed the first culturally adapted autism screening tool for West Africa.
- Conducted 140+ interviews and focus groups with caregivers, teachers, and health workers during fieldwork in Sierra Leone.
- Managed qualitative data for meta-synthesis and manuscript preparation.
- Presented on healthcare disparities and the Sierra Leone health system at the Global Health Learning Lab (LVHN) and Engagement Scholarship Consortium (ESC).







Bethlehem, PA Â· January â€“ December 2023 - Mentored interdisciplinary student teams working on global social impact and community-engaged projects.
- Supported proposal writing, grant development, conference submissions, and manuscript reviews.
- Evaluated student work related to financial planning, sustainability, and long-term project development.







June â€“ August 2023 - Studied international health systems through coursework and immersive field experiences.
- Gained comparative insights into global health governance, health equity, and policy design.

title: Publications and Conferences
text:
(Springer, 2025 â€” First Author)



Springer Â· Conference publication following CSCEâ€™24 presentation.

This work, presented at CSCEâ€™24 in Las Vegas and conducted with Prof.Â Gideon Gogovi, explores how handwriting analytics can support early Alzheimerâ€™s detection.
We identified key handwriting-based features with strong predictive value, demonstrating handwritingâ€™s potential as a non-invasive biomarker.
I am proud to be the first author of this publication.




(IET Healthcare Technology Letters - Co-Author)



IET Healthcare Technology Letters Â· 2025


ðŸ”— Read the Paper


This publication shows how machine learning applied to handwriting tasks can support early Alzheimerâ€™s classification.
Our analysis highlights features such as cognitive processing speed and recall confidence that strongly contribute to model performance.
Co-authored with Gideon Gogovi and Maeve Ho, with support from the Lehigh University College of Health.

title: Publications and Conferences
section: Annual Biomedical Research Conference for Minoritized Scientists (ABRCMS), 2024
text:
Annual Biomedical Research Conference for Minoritized Scientists (ABRCMS), 2024



ABRCMS 2024 â€“ Poster Presentation


Title: Technologies for Transition: A Survey of Assistive Technologies for Individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) During the Transition to Adulthood


At ABRCMS 2024, I presented research on how assistive technologies can support adolescents and young adults with ASD as they navigate key life transitions such as higher education, employment, and independent living.
This work was supported by mentors including Dr.Â Neal Simon, Dr.Â Ware, Prof.Â Fathima Wakeel, and Prof.Â Vinod Namboodiri, and highlighted the importance of improving resources and systems for neurodivergent individuals while advancing diversity and inclusion in STEM.

title: Publications and Conferences
section: World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, & Applied Computing (CSCEâ€™24) â€“ HIMSâ€™24, 2024
text:
World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, & Applied Computing (CSCEâ€™24) â€“ HIMSâ€™24, 2024



CSCEâ€™24 â€“ 10th International Conference on Health Informatics & Medical Systems (HIMSâ€™24)


Presentation: Explainable Machine Learning-Based Alzheimerâ€™s Disease Prediction


At CSCEâ€™24 in Las Vegas, I presented our work on leveraging handwriting data and explainable machine learning models for early detection of Alzheimerâ€™s disease.
In collaboration with Prof.Â Gideon Gogovi, we demonstrated how handwriting-derived features can serve as promising, non-invasive markers for early AD screening and personalized intervention strategies.
This research was supported by the Lehigh University College of Health and the Dean of Students, and has been published by Springer.

title: Publications and Conferences
section: Lehigh University College of Health Research Symposium (2022â€“2024) & STEM-SI Program 2024
text:
Lehigh University College of Health Research Symposium (2022â€“2024) & STEM-SI Program 2024



College of Health Research Symposia & STEM-SI Program


Presentations: Assistive Technologies for ASD & Global Health/Community-Engaged Projects


Across multiple years (2022â€“2024), I presented research at the Lehigh University College of Health Research Symposium, including work on assistive technologies for individuals with ASD and community-engaged health projects.
As part of the STEM-SI program, I conducted a comprehensive review of assistive technologies supporting transition-age individuals with ASD and learned about the CityGuide assistive technology system, which supports indoor navigation for individuals with disabilities.
These experiences strengthened my interests in global health, disability, and technology-driven solutions.

title: Publications and Conferences
section: Global Health Learning Lab, Lehigh Valley Health Network, 2022
text:
Global Health Learning Lab, Lehigh Valley Health Network, 2022



Global Health Learning Lab â€“ Lehigh Valley Health Network


Topic: Healthcare Disparities and the Health System in Sierra Leone


As part of the Global Social Impact Fellowship (ASTIA), I contributed to a Global Health Learning Lab session for resident physicians at Lehigh Valley Health Network.
I presented on healthcare disparities and the structure of the health system in Sierra Leone, drawing on fieldwork focused on autism screening and community perceptions of disability.
This work was closely linked to our efforts to develop culturally appropriate autism screening tools for West African communities.

title: Publications and Conferences
text:
Engagement Scholarship Consortium (ESC), 2022



Engagement Scholarship Consortium (ESC), 2022


Poster Presentation: Autism Screening and Training in Africa (ASTIA)


At the Engagement Scholarship Consortium (ESC) 2022, I presented a poster on the Autism Screening and Training in Africa (ASTIA) project, highlighting strategies for proactive community engagement and partner involvement in research.
Our work emphasized building sustainable, equitable partnerships, elevating local perspectives on disability, and designing tools that are both scientifically rigorous and culturally grounded.

title: Welcome to my website!
text:
Welcome to my website!
Hi! Iâ€™m Paulina Gonzalez, a first-year PhD student in Epidemiology and Biostatistics at Case Western Reserve University. I graduated with High Honors from Lehigh University in May 2025 with a Bachelor of Science in Population Health and minors in Biostatistics and Probability & Statistics.
My work centers on population health, statistical methods, and the genetics and epigenetics of Alzheimerâ€™s disease. Iâ€™m passionate about using rigorous, reproducible data science to address real-world public health challenges and improve health outcomes in diverse, underserved communities.
